info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 31 at 6:46AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern McDowell, central Rutherford, Polk, southwestern Caldwell and western Burke Counties through 715 AM EDT... At 646 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles northeast of Marion to near Columbus. Movement was east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Morganton, Marion, Rutherfordton, Columbus, Forest City, Lenoir, Spindale, Gamewell, Tryon and Glen Alpine. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
